intro: Antidesma orthogyne, commonly known as the red antidesma, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stems. The plant produces small, clustered yellowish-green flowers, which are followed by red, fleshy berries that are a notable feature of the species. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is often found in moist, shaded environments. The plant's botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
